content: pattern refers to needle 1 that will actually comprise the stitches on your 1st and 2nd needles together anytime the pattern refers to needle 2 that will actually comprise the stitches on your 3rd and 4th needle glossary bobble bind off m1 make 1 p2tog purl 2 together co cast off m1l make 1 left sl slip k knit m1r make 1 right st/sts stitch es kfb knit front and back p purl s2kp slip 2 knit pass m marker pfb purl front and back w&t wrap and turn toe begins at minute mark 2 41 1 toe - a note for 2-color socks if you - using judy s magic cast on and the larger needles co 16 20 24 28 would like to duplicate the color 28 28 sts 8 10 12 14 14 14 sts on each needle changes of the sample begin work 1 k all sts with the toe-color yarn 2 increase round *k1 m1 k to 1 sts before the end of the needle m1 k1 ** repeat from * to ** for the 2nd needle 20 24 28 32 32 32 sts increase round begins at minute mark 7 09 - repeat rounds 1 2 until there are 24 28 32 36 40 44 sts on each needle 48 56 64 72 80 88 sts total 2 insole begins at minute mark 9 16 2 insole - 2-color note continue with toe- - work in stockinette stitch k every round until the work measures color yarn until you have worked 4 2 2 25 2 5 2 75 3 3 /5 5 5 6 5 7 7 5 7 5 cm from co plain row of the insole then switch to the body-color yarn - k2 slip the next 20 24 28 32 36 40 sts to a holder for ribbing consolidate all the remaining 26 30 34 38 44 46 sts on the main needle to work in turned row begin turned row begins at minute mark 12 28 1 ws sl 1 p to the end turn 2 rs sl 1 k to the end turn - alternate row 1 2 until the work measures 3 25 /8 cm less than the desired foot length ending after completing a ws row a note on sizing i have written this pattern to have about 25 / 5 cm of negative ease lengthwise this will help keep your socks on your feet if you like your socks even more snug you can repeat row 1 2 until the work measures 3 5 /9 cm instead this will give you 5 /1 5 cm negative ease lengthwise conversely if you like a looser fitting sock as i do you can repeat row 1 2 until the work measures 3 /7 5 cm for zero ease lengthwise gusset begins at minute mark 16 40 3 gusset - 1 increase row sl 1 k1 m1l k to the last 2 sts m1r k to the end
